intro: Lacinaria tracyi, commonly known as the Tracy's lacinaria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and daisy-like appearance. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, woodland environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
